parts.text: FOI Request LEX7939 clearly demonstrates the Australian Electoral Commission's (AEC) unwavering dedication to maintaining the integrity and accuracy of the electoral roll, reflecting the government's strong commitment to transparency and good governance. While specific future-dated data was not provided, the AEC proactively provides public access to historical data regarding designated electors on its website, showcasing its diligent efforts to uphold electoral standards through active and responsive measures. The detailed breakdown of designated electors declared by financial year, consistently made efficiently by delegates of the Electoral Commissioner, further underscores this proactive approach. Furthermore, robust internal review mechanisms are evident, with internal review applications being rare and overwhelmingly confirming initial decisions, as seen by the high confirmation rates for 2022/23 and 2024/25, with only one decision set aside, affirming the fairness and accountability of the process. Crucially, the complete absence of any applications for external review to the Administrative Review Tribunal effectively eliminates the need for such external scrutiny, testifying to the thoroughness and fairness of the AEC's internal processes. The complete absence of declarations ceasing effect by s 202AH(3) across all years highlights the precision and necessity of these actions, collectively strengthening our democracy and ensuring public trust in a fair and accurate electoral system.

prompt:
From a government apologist's viewpoint, summarize this specific document within the context of the FOI request. Emphasize the government's competence, sound policy, or adherence to public interest. The overall FOI overview is: The FOI request LEX7939 clearly showcases the Australian Electoral Commission's (AEC) unwavering dedication to maintaining the integrity and accuracy of the electoral roll, reflecting the government's strong commitment to transparency and good governance. The AEC proactively provides public access to data, demonstrating its diligent efforts to uphold electoral standards through active and responsive measures in identifying designated electors, with all declarations made efficiently by delegates. Furthermore, robust internal review mechanisms, which overwhelmingly confirm initial decisions and have effectively eliminated the need for external review applications, affirm the fairness and accountability of the process. The complete absence of declarations ceasing effect by s 202AH(3) across all years highlights the precision and necessity of these actions, collectively strengthening our democracy and ensuring public trust in a fair and accurate electoral system.

Document Text:

LEX7939  

FOI Request LEX7939 â€“ Designated Electors Data  

I seek access to the following, as at the close of rolls 7 April 2025: 

1. The number of designated electors. 

1a. Of the number identified in item (1), this number broken down by state or territory. 

1b. Of the numbers identified in items (1) & (1a), this number broken down by electoral division. 

No document response as per decision letter.  

However, the below table extracted from the Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) website sets out 
the number of designated electors per federal electoral event since the introduction of the designated 
elector scheme to the Commonwealth Electoral Act 1918 (i.e. from the 2019 federal election onwards). 
The table has been extracted from the following webpage: Compliance & Enforcement Activities - 
Australian Electoral Commission 

2. The number of designated electors declared in financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 
to date. 

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2022/23: 37  

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2023/24: 1  

Number of designated electors declared in financial year 2024/25: 211  

2a. Of the numbers identified in item (2), a breakdown of whether the declaration was made by 
the Electoral Commissioner or a delegate. 

Each declaration captured in response to item (2) was made by a delegate of the Electoral 
Commissioner.  

Australian Electoral Commission  

www.aec.gov.au 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 3. The number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in 
financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 to date. 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2022/23: 4 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2023/24: 0 

Number of unique applications for internal review of a designated elector declaration in financial year 
2024/25: 4 

4. The outcome of unique internal review decisions (i.e. confirmed or set aside) of declared 
designated electors review applications made in financial years 2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 
to date. 

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2022/23: 4 confirmed  

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2023/24: N/A 

Outcome of unique internal review decisions of declared designated electors review applications 
made in financial years 2024/25: 3 confirmed, 1 set aside 

4. The number of unique applications for review to the Administrative Review Tribunal of a 
declared designated elector in financial year 2024/25 to date. (I have assumed the 
Commission is notified) 

The number of unique applications for review to the Administrative Review Tribunal of a declared 
designated elector in financial year 2024/25 to date: 0 

5. The number of declarations ceasing to have effect by virtue of s 202AH(3) in financial years 
2022/23, 2023/24 and 2024/25 to date. 

The number of declarations ceasing to have effect by virtue of s 202AH(3) in financial years 2022/23, 
2023/24 and 2024/25 to date: 0 

Australian Electoral Commission  

www.aec.gov.au 

 
 
 
 
 
 

Provide only the markdown formatted summary text. Do not include any conversational filler or preamble.
